results.title: As young as you feel
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Lamar Trotti and Harmon Jones
results.brief_description: John Hodges (Monty Woolley) is a printer for the Acme Printing Company, who in turn are owned through various sub-siduaries by Consolidated Motors. This is where our problem begins… Consolidated Motors has a Personnel Policy stating “All workers over 65 have to retire”, and our John Hodges does not want to be forcibly retired and wants his job back. He wishes to fight for the principle of dignity - both in life and at work. “There is more to life than mere success” he attests, but how does he go about this courageous though some may say futile enterprise? He dyes his hair black and pays a visit to the offices of Mr McKinley, manager at Acme Printing, where he meets Marilyn Monroe as the company secretary in one of her first and funniest roles. Posing as President of Consolidated Motors in order to get the policy overturned, he finds himself feted and listened to as a elder statesman of the Business World. Cast also includes Thelma Ritter, David Wayne, Jean Peters, Constance Bennett and many others who give stirling performances, also includes a very young Russ Tamblyn.

results.title: As you like it
results.creator_credit: BBC, Time-Life Films, Cedric Messina and Basil Coleman
results.brief_description: Orlando is forced to flee to the forest to escape the evil plots of his jealous brother, Oliver. Rosalind incurs her uncle’s wrath and also flees to the forest, accompanied by Celia and Touchstone the clown. Disguised as a youth known as Ganymede, Rosalind meets Orlando who confides his love for Rosalind to Ganymede (Rosalind). Oliver arrives in the forest and is saved from certain death by Orlando and the two brothers are reconciled. Oliver woos Celia, Touchstone woos the dullwitted Audrey, Silvius (a shepherd) woos Phoebe and Phoebe woos the disguised Rosalind who finally reveals her identity to Orlando. The four pairs of lovers are united in the feast of Hymen.

results.title: As tears go by
results.creator_credit: In-gear Film, Rover Tang and Wong
results.brief_description: Wong Kar-wai describes his first feature as ‘a tragedy set in the big city, focussing on several ordinary characters in a hopeless situation’. It has also been described as ‘an idiosyncratic riff on the plot and themes of Scorsese’s Mean Streets’. Ah Wah (Andy Lau) is an enigmatic hit man who, with his offsider Fly (Jacky Cheung), is, despite himself, dragged into trouble time and time again. The arrival of his cousin (Maggie Cheung) briefly offers hope of escape from the downward spiral. The emphasis is more on atmosphere and interplay between the three characters than upon plot. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Artists and models
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Hal B Wallis and Frank Tashlin
results.brief_description: In this satirical slapstick comedy Dean Martin plays Rick Todd, a fledging painter who has relocated to New York in search of acclaim. Eugene, Rick’s best friend and housemate also has ambitions, as a children’s writer, but his clumsy antics continuously lose them menial jobs that they land. Despite their misfortunes the impoverished pair dream of greater things, such as food, girls, money and fame. Along the way, the friends woo their luscious neighbours, comic book artist Abigail (Dorothy Malone) and her model, Bessie (Shirley MacLaine). When Abigail resigns after being asked to beef up her storylines with more blood and gore, Rick takes her job, using Eugene’s ecstatic and vivid dreams as material. Eugene dreams up the secret formula for rocket fuel, and enemy agents are soon on his tail. Several musical interludes pepper the film that is alight with sight gags, physical and madcap humour, and despite its largely formulaic approach, is one of the finest Lewis and Martin comedies made as a duo.

results.title: Arthur
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Robert Greenhut and Steve Gordon
results.brief_description: Arthur Bach is a lonely and depressed alcoholic millionaire whose constant boozing and womanising mask profound unhappiness. His father and grandmother disapprove of his slovenly ways and have arranged for him to marry a suitably upper-class bore whom Arthur despises but complies when he is threatened with disinheritance. Arthur is forced to choose between wealth and love when he meets Linda Marolla (Liza Minnelli) and is drawn to her working class charm and sincerity. The screenplay is littered with witty one-liners mainly delivered by Dudley Moore, preceding gales of (his own) laughter. Although this habit occasionally grates it also reveals Arthur’s deep ridden angst about the emptiness of his moneyed existence. “Arthur” was an enormous hit at the box office and John Gielgud won an Academy award for his acerbic performance as Arthur’s confidant and butler. The binary conflicts between tradition and freedom, affluence and contentment, youth and age are reminiscent of the screwball comedies of the 1940s.

results.title: Around the world in eighty days
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Michael Todd, Michael Anderson and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Winner of the Best Picture Oscar, “Around the world in eighty days” is super-showman Mike Todd’s spectacular global pageant based on Jules Verne’s classic novel. Suave Phileas Fogg, accompanied by his manservant Passepartout, sets out at the turn of the century to circle the globe in eighty days in order to win a wager. David Niven, Cantinflas, Shirley MacLaine and Robert Newton in the major roles are supported by a dazzling array of 44 international stars in cameo roles.

results.title: Arizona dream
results.creator_credit: CNC, Canal+, Constellation, Hachette Premiere, Yves Marmion, Claudie Ossard and Emir Kusturica
results.brief_description:
Serbian born director Emir Kusturica’s first English language film is an absurdist comedy that focuses on the quirks of small town U.S. culture. Kusturica grafts his sometimes unwieldy Europe-inflected concerns onto brash American landscapes with mixed results. Johnny Depp stars as Axel, a young drifter caught between the dreams of youth and the responsibilities of adulthood. Enticed back to his Arizona hometown, the oddball residents take more than a passing interest in him. While his uncle Leo tries to convince him to take over the family’s cadillac dealership, Axel becomes caught up in a love triangle with a wealthy widow and her stepdaughter.
Cast also includes: Jerry Lewis, Faye Dunaway, Lili Taylor and Vincent Gallo.

results.title: Arachnophobia
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Kathleen Kennedy, Richard Vane and Frank Marshall
results.brief_description: A doctor who is deathly afraid of spiders moves his family to a small town where the arachnids are attacking the townspeople. He must overcome his fear to save the community, but it may already be too late! Cast includes Jeff Daniels, Julian Sands, Harley Jane Kozak, John Goodman.

results.title: Apocalypse now
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola and Omni Zoetrope
results.brief_description: Francis Ford Coppola’s stunning vision of man’s heart of darkness, revealed through the particular madness of the Vietnam War. Lieutenant Willard (Martin Sheen) receives orders to seek out the renegade Colonel Kurtz (Marlon Brando) who has disappeared into the depths of the jungle. Willard’s mission becomes an epic journey into his own soul and that of the mysterious Kurtz. Based on the novella by Joseph Conrad, “Heart of Darkness”. Original music by Carmine Coppola, Francis Ford Coppola, Mickey Hart.

results.title: Antz [DVD]
results.creator_credit: NBCUniversal, PDI Group, Brad Lewis, Aron Warner, Patty Wooton, Eric Darnell and Tim Johnson
results.brief_description: This dazzling computer animated comedy uses with great comic effect the neurotic persona of Woody Allen in order to tell the story of Z (Allen), a down trodden worker ant struggling to assert his individuality amongst the conformity of the ant colony. Z’s transformation from faceless nobody to unwilling hero eventuates when he volunteers to swap places with his fearless soldier ant buddy Weaver (Sylvester Stallone), in order to get close to the feisty Princess Bala (Sharon Stone). This lands the nervous insect right in the middle of the brutal termite wars and a series of misadventures, accumulating in the search for the mythical “Insectopia”. Directors Eric Darnell and Tim Johnson have a lot of fun by visually suggesting a microscopic world not unlike New York city and by giving the animated ants the physical traits and mannerisms of their voice-over counterparts. Gene Hackman, Dan Aykroyd, Jennifer Lopez, Danny Glover, Christopher Walken and Ann Bancroft are among the many who contribute their voices.
